alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 4:49AM AKST until January 01 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow transitioning to mixed precipitation. Snow accumulations of 6 to 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph through the northern portions of Turnagain Pass. * WHERE...Seward Highway Corridor from the Sterling Highway Cutoff through Turnagain Pass. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST today. * IMPACTS...Travel could be extremely hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snowfall rates of one to three inches an hour are likely through the morning hours near Summit Lake and Turnagain Pass. Snow levels will climb through this afternoon, reaching between 1200 ft and 1500 ft (around the summit of Turnagain Pass and Summit Lake). This will transition precipitation from snow to a mix of rain and snow or heavy rain. Mixed precipitation or heavy rain falling onto snow covered roadways will create hazardous driving conditions. Depending on the timing of the transition between rain and snow, snow totals may be higher or lower. Heavy snow combined with strong winds, mainly through the Turnagain Pass area, could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
